results.title: The Computer programme No. 1-5
results.creator_credit: Frank Ash, Matt Boney and BBC
results.brief_description: This ten part series which presents the basic concepts of microcomputers and their effects on our lives. No.1 “It’s Happening Now” - Explores the abilities of computers and shows how much a part of everyday life they have already become. No.2 “One Thing After Another” - Explains that a computer program is simply a logical set of instructions. No.3 “Talking to a Machine” - A computer language like BASIC is more like English than at first thought. No.4 “It’s on the Computer” - The storage of information and how to access it. Shows the British Museum Science Reference Library and a modern hospital where a Commodore PET is seen in operation. No.5 “The New Media” - Computer uses for our daily needs at home and in the office.

results.title: Return to the dreaming
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Robert Raymond and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian ark”.
Yirrawala, the great Aboriginal painter, takes his two sons who have grown up in the white man’s world back into Arnhem Land in an attempt to find the sacred caves and art galleries of his tribe. During the journey Yirrawala makes a bark painting in the traditional way and we see cave paintings never before recorded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cecil Holmes, Robert Raymond and Opus Films

group_siblings.title: The Coming of man
group_siblings.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Vincent Serventy and Opus Films

results.title: The Coming of man
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Vincent Serventy and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian ark”.
Aboriginal man is now known to have come to Australia at least 40,000 years ago, maybe even 50,000 years ago. Leading anthropologists, including Norman Tindale, John Mulvaney, Richard Wright and Bob Edwards explain their finds, including a 30,000 year old skull of a cremated woman at Lake Mungo, the Kow Swamp excavation of skeletons which resemble Java man, the 20,000 year old wall markings of the Koonalda Cave and the strange engraved stone faces of the Cleland Hills.

results.title: The Company of strangers [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, David Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A bus breaks down in the wilderness. Eight elderly women, average age 71, are stranded at a deserted farmhouse. They have only their wits, their memories, and eventually some roasted frogs’ legs, to sustain them. Through the long days and nights this remarkable group of strangers share their life stories and exchange intimate thoughts; turning the crisis into a magical time of humour and spirit. Featuring non-professional actors and spontaneous dialogue, this memorable film dissolves the barrier between fiction and reality, weaving a heartwarming tale of friendship and courage. Cast: Cissy Meddings, Mary Meigs, Catherine Roche, Michelle Sweeney, Beth Webber, Alice Diabo, Constance Garneau, Winifred Holden. Script, Gloria Demers, Cynthia Scott, David Wilson and Sally Bochner. Cinematography, David de Volpi. Music, Marie Bernard. Editing, David Wilson.

results.title: The Communal sense of modesty = Il commune senso del pudore
results.creator_credit: Alberto Sordi, Fausto Saraceni and Rizzoli Film
results.brief_description: Four humorous vignettes starring and directed by top Italian comic actor Alberto Sordi which take place on the same day. The first tells of a conservative married couple in search of a movie theatre which take place on the same day. The second is about life in a successful magazine company. The third deals with the increasing popularity of sex magazines in Italy. The fourth and final story tells of a ‘primadonna’ actress constantly throwing tantrums in a film studio. In Italian language with no English subtitles.

results.title: The Comic Spirit (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A look at the different elements of comedy, performed and workshopped by the New Shakespeare Company from the Open Air Theatre in Regent’s Park. Shows sequences from modern comedy routines and relates these ideas of the comic genre to scenes from a number of Shakespearian comedies.

results.title: The Coen brothers
results.brief_description: This low-key documentary on filmmaking brothers Ethan and Joel Coen, was made during the filming of “O Brother where art thou?” The media shy brothers are reputed for playing with established film genres, and a disciplined approach that has enabled them to gain autonomy from studio executives and artistic freedom to create idiosyncratic, original work. Their oeuvre includes “Fargo”, “Raising Arizona”, “The Big Lebowski”, “The Hudsucker proxy”, “Miller’s crossing” and “Barton Fink”. The Coens’ meticulous planning of production allows them to consistently deliver films on budget that often achieve cult status. As a film student Joel was working on others’ low budget films, before undertaking the writing of original scripts with his philosophy graduate brother, Ethan. Their first film, “Blood simple” was an instantaneous alternative classic. The brothers have an unusual style in that they both contribute to filmmaking tasks and share screenwriting recognition, but Joel is credited with directing and Ethan with producing. Features interviews with the Coens, George Clooney, Peter Stormare, Holly Hunter, Jeff Bridges, John Turturro, former school teachers, and a range of close friends who attempt to explain the Coens’ relaxed and symbiotic working relationship. Although they have made the occasional dud, the Coens are consistent in their output and appear to have an untapped well of ideas at their disposal.

results.title: The Cloudmaker
results.creator_credit: Leah Miller, Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Animation, in which a tiny figure struggling in a gigantic electro-mechanical world challenges the viewer to think about how one can live, work and fit into, and find satisfaction in a large technological society. No commentary, music soundtrack only.

results.title: The Clifford rotary cultivator
results.creator_credit: G Burger, Clifford Aero and Auto Ltd and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Describes and illustrates the rotary cultivator, the machine that does the ploughing, harrowing and cultivating in one operation. Commentary by Frank Phillips.
